replit.md.content:
# Overview

This is a full-stack web application for cannabis business compliance document management called "Secure2Send". The application provides a streamlined platform for cannabis businesses to submit compliance documents and for administrators to review and approve them. It features separate client and admin dashboards with comprehensive document management capabilities including upload, review, approval/rejection workflows, and progress tracking.

## Current Status (January 2025)
✅ **COMPLETE AND FUNCTIONAL** - Custom authentication system implemented
- Professional Secure2Send branding and UI implemented
- **Custom authentication with email/password login system**
- Client and Admin dashboards fully functional
- Document upload system with drag & drop interface operational
- 17 cannabis compliance document types supported
- Admin review and approval system working
- Progress tracking for clients implemented
- Database schema deployed and running
- Secure password hashing with bcrypt
- Session-based authentication with PostgreSQL storage

# User Preferences

Preferred communication style: Simple, everyday language.

# System Architecture

## Frontend Architecture
The client-side is built as a React Single Page Application (SPA) using Vite as the build tool. The frontend follows a component-based architecture with:
- **Component Library**: shadcn/ui components built on Radix UI primitives for consistent, accessible UI elements
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with CSS custom properties for theming support
- **State Management**: TanStack Query (React Query) for server state management with optimistic updates
- **Routing**: Wouter for lightweight client-side routing
- **Form Handling**: React Hook Form for form state management with validation
- **File Upload**: React Dropzone for drag-and-drop file upload interfaces

## Backend Architecture
The server follows an Express.js REST API architecture with:
- **Web Framework**: Express.js with TypeScript for type safety
- **Database Layer**: Drizzle ORM for type-safe database operations with PostgreSQL
- **File Upload**: Multer middleware for handling multipart form data and file uploads
- **Session Management**: Express sessions with PostgreSQL storage for persistence
- **API Design**: RESTful endpoints with consistent error handling and JSON responses

## Authentication System
Authentication is implemented using a custom email/password system:
- **Provider**: Custom authentication with secure password hashing (bcrypt)
- **Session Storage**: PostgreSQL-backed sessions using connect-pg-simple and Passport.js
- **Authorization**: Role-based access control with CLIENT and ADMIN roles
- **Middleware**: Passport.js LocalStrategy with custom authentication middleware
- **Security**: Secure password hashing with salt, session-based auth, CSRF protection

## Database Design
The PostgreSQL database uses Drizzle ORM with a normalized schema:
- **Users Table**: Stores user profiles with roles (CLIENT/ADMIN)
- **Clients Table**: Business information and approval status
- **Documents Table**: File metadata, types, and review status
- **Sessions Table**: Server-side session storage for authentication
- **Enums**: Strongly typed status enums for consistency

## File Storage Strategy
Files are stored locally on the server filesystem:
- **Upload Directory**: Dedicated uploads folder with security restrictions
- **File Validation**: MIME type checking and size limits (50MB)
- **Supported Formats**: PDF, JPG, PNG for document uploads
- **Security**: File type validation and secure file serving

# External Dependencies

## Database Infrastructure
- **Neon Database**: PostgreSQL database service via @neondatabase/serverless
- **Connection Pooling**: Built-in connection pooling for scalability

## UI Component System
- **Radix UI**: Comprehensive set of unstyled, accessible UI primitives
- **Shadcn/ui**: Pre-built components with Tailwind CSS styling
- **Tailwind CSS**: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid styling

## Development Tools
- **Vite**: Fast build tool and development server
- **TypeScript**: Static type checking across the entire application
- **Drizzle Kit**: Database migration and schema management tools

## File Processing
- **Multer**: Express middleware for handling file uploads
- **React Dropzone**: Drag-and-drop file upload component

## Authentication Provider
- **Custom Auth**: Email/password authentication with bcrypt password hashing
- **Passport.js**: Authentication middleware with LocalStrategy for email/password login

## Session Management
- **Connect PG Simple**: PostgreSQL session store for Express sessions
- **Express Session**: Server-side session management

## Development Environment
- **Replit**: Cloud-based development environment with integrated deployment
- **Replit Cartographer**: Development tooling for Replit environment
- **Replit Runtime Error Modal**: Enhanced error reporting during development

# Secure2Send - Cannabis Compliance Document Management System - Replit Agent Prompt

## Project Overview
Create a complete Next.js web application called "Secure2Send" for cannabis business compliance document management. This is a PROTOTYPE that will later be migrated to production, so focus on functionality over production-grade security.

**Application Name**: Secure2Send
**Domain**: secure2send.com (mentioned in branding/headers)
**Purpose**: Streamline cannabis business compliance document submission and approval process

## Tech Stack Requirements (MANDATORY)
- **Framework**: Next.js 14+ with TypeScript and App Router
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui components for premium look
- **Database**: Prisma ORM with SQLite for prototype
- **Authentication**: NextAuth.js with email/password
- **Forms**: React Hook Form + Zod validation
- **File Upload**: react-dropzone + uploadthing for professional drag & drop
- **Icons**: Lucide React
- **UI Components**: shadcn/ui for polished, modern interface
- **Animations**: Framer Motion for smooth interactions
- **Notifications**: react-hot-toast for elegant feedback

## Project Structure (CREATE EXACTLY THIS)
```
├── app/
│   ├── (auth)/
│   │   ├── login/
│   │   │   └── page.tsx
│   │   └── register/
│   │       └── page.tsx
│   ├── dashboard/
│   │   ├── layout.tsx
│   │   ├── page.tsx
│   │   └── documents/
│   │       └── page.tsx
│   ├── admin/
│   │   ├── layout.tsx
│   │   ├── page.tsx
│   │   └── documents/
│   │       └── [id]/
│   │           └── page.tsx
│   ├── api/
│   │   ├── auth/
│   │   │   └── [...nextauth]/
│   │   │       └── route.ts
│   │   ├── register/
│   │   │   └── route.ts
│   │   ├── documents/
│   │   │   ├── route.ts
│   │   │   └── [id]/
│   │   │       └── route.ts
│   │   └── admin/
│   │       └── documents/
│   │           └── route.ts
│   ├── components/
│   │   ├── ui/
│   │   │   ├── Button.tsx
│   │   │   ├── Input.tsx
│   │   │   └── Card.tsx
│   │   ├── DocumentUpload.tsx
│   │   ├── DocumentList.tsx
│   │   ├── AdminDocumentReview.tsx
│   │   └── ProgressBar.tsx
│   ├── lib/
│   │   ├── auth.ts
│   │   ├── db.ts

│   │   └── validations.ts
│   ├── types/

│   ├── globals.css

├── prisma/

├── public/

├── tsconfig.json
└── package.json
```

## Database Schema (IMPLEMENT EXACTLY)
```prisma
// prisma/schema.prisma
generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "sqlite"
  url      = "file:./dev.db"
}

model User {
  id            String    @id @default(cuid())
  email         String    @unique
  password      String    // hashed with bcrypt
  firstName     String
  lastName      String
  companyName   String?
  role          UserRole  @default(CLIENT)
  emailVerified Boolean   @default(false)
  createdAt     DateTime  @default(now())
  updatedAt     DateTime  @updatedAt
  
  // Relations
  clients       Client[]
  sessions      Session[]
}

model Session {
  id           String   @id @default(cuid())
  sessionToken String   @unique
  userId       String
  expires      DateTime
  user         User     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
}

model Client {
  id          String       @id @default(cuid())
  userId      String       // The user who created this client profile
  status      ClientStatus @default(PENDING)
  createdAt   DateTime     @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime     @updatedAt
  
  // Relations
  user        User         @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  documents   Document[]
}

model Document {
  id              String         @id @default(cuid())
  filename        String
  originalName    String
  fileSize        Int
  mimeType        String
  filePath        String         // Local file path for prototype
  documentType    DocumentType
  status          DocumentStatus @default(PENDING)
  rejectionReason String?
  clientId        String
  uploadedAt      DateTime       @default(now())
  reviewedAt      DateTime?
  
  // Relations
  client          Client         @relation(fields: [clientId], references: [id])
}

enum UserRole {
  ADMIN
  CLIENT
}

enum ClientStatus {
  PENDING
  APPROVED
  REJECTED
  INCOMPLETE
}

enum DocumentType {
  SS4_EIN_LETTER
  W9
  BENEFICIAL_OWNERSHIP
  DRIVERS_LICENSE
  PASSPORT
  CANNABIS_LICENSE
  SEED_TO_SALE_INFO
  POS_INFO
  BANKING_INFO
  BANK_STATEMENTS
  ARTICLES_OF_INCORPORATION
  OPERATING_AGREEMENT
  BUSINESS_LICENSE
  VOIDED_CHECK
  COA_PRODUCTS
  PROVIDER_CONTRACT
  INSURANCE_COVERAGE
}

enum DocumentStatus {
  PENDING
  APPROVED
  REJECTED
}
```

## Required Document Types with Validation Rules
```typescript
export const DOCUMENT_REQUIREMENTS = {
  SS4_EIN_LETTER: {
    name: "SS-4 IRS EIN Confirmation Letter or W9",
    description: "Official IRS documentation",
    required: true,
    maxSize: 10, // MB
    acceptedTypes: ["application/pdf", "image/jpeg", "image/png"]
  },
  BENEFICIAL_OWNERSHIP: {
};

## Core Application Features (MUST IMPLEMENT ALL)

### 1. User Registration & Authentication
- **Registration Form**: First Name, Last Name, Email, Company Name, Password, Confirm Password
- **Email/Password Login**: Standard authentication
- **Role-based Access**: CLIENT (default) and ADMIN roles
- **Session Management**: Secure session handling
- **Password Hashing**: Use bcrypt for password security

### 2. Client Dashboard Features
- **Document Upload Interface**: Drag & drop with progress indicators
- **Upload Progress Tracking**: Visual progress bar showing completion percentage
- **Document Status Display**: PENDING (yellow), APPROVED (green), REJECTED (red)
- **Rejection Feedback**: Display rejection reasons from admin
- **File Validation**: Size limits, file type checking, error handling
- **Re-upload Capability**: Allow replacing rejected documents

### 3. Admin Dashboard Features
- **Client List View**: All registered clients with status overview
- **Document Review Interface**: View/download documents for review
- **Approve/Reject Actions**: One-click approval or rejection with reason
- **Bulk Actions**: Approve/reject multiple documents
- **Search & Filter**: Find clients by name, company, status
- **Activity Log**: Track admin actions and timestamps

### 4. Document Management System
- **File Upload Handling**: Server-side validation and storage
- **Document Categories**: All 14 required document types (see DOCUMENT_REQUIREMENTS)
- **Status Tracking**: PENDING → APPROVED/REJECTED workflow
- **File Storage**: Local file system for prototype (uploads/ directory)
- **Download Capability**: Admins can download submitted documents
- **Metadata Storage**: Original filename, size, upload date, etc.

### 5. Notification System (Simplified for Prototype)
- **Console Logging**: Log all email notifications that would be sent
- **Admin Actions**: Log when documents are approved/rejected
- **Status Updates**: Log when client uploads documents
- **Future Email Integration**: Prepare structure for real email service

## UI/UX Requirements

### Design System & Branding
- **App Name**: "Secure2Send" prominently displayed in header with professional logo treatment
- **Design Style**: Modern, clean, premium SaaS application aesthetic
- **Color Scheme**: 
  - Primary: Sophisticated blue (#2563eb) with gradients
  - Success: Modern green (#10b981) 
  - Warning: Warm amber (#f59e0b)
  - Error: Clean red (#ef4444)
  - Background: Clean whites and subtle grays (#f8fafc, #f1f5f9)
- **Typography**: Inter font for modern, professional look
- **Shadows & Depth**: Subtle shadows and borders for card depth
- **Animations**: Smooth micro-interactions and transitions
- **Layout**: Spacious, breathing room, premium feel like Stripe/Linear/Notion

### Premium UI Components to Implement
```typescript
// Use shadcn/ui components for professional look:
// - Button variants (default, outline, ghost, link)
// - Input with proper focus states and validation styling
// - Card with subtle shadows and hover effects
// - Badge for status indicators
// - Progress bars with smooth animations
// - Dialog/Modal for confirmations
// - Table for admin document review
// - Tabs for navigation
// - Avatar for user profiles
// - Dropdown menus with proper animations
// - Toast notifications for feedback
```

### Key Design Features for Owner Impression
- **Glass morphism effects** for modern card designs
- **Smooth animations** on all interactions (hover, click, page transitions)
- **Professional data tables** for admin with sorting, filtering
- **Drag & drop zones** with elegant hover states and upload animations
- **Progress indicators** with smooth transitions and celebratory completion
- **Status badges** with appropriate colors and subtle animations
- **Professional loading states** with skeleton screens
- **Empty states** with helpful illustrations and clear CTAs
- **Mobile-first responsive** that looks great on all devices

### Key UI Components to Build
```typescript
// Premium shadcn/ui based components:
// components/ui/* - All shadcn/ui components (Button, Input, Card, etc.)
// components/DocumentUpload.tsx - Beautiful drag & drop with animations
// components/DocumentList.tsx - Elegant document cards with status
// components/AdminDocumentReview.tsx - Professional admin interface
// components/ProgressBar.tsx - Animated progress with celebrations
// components/Layout.tsx - Premium app layout with sidebar navigation
// components/Header.tsx - Professional header with Secure2Send branding
// components/Dashboard.tsx - Beautiful overview with metrics cards
// components/StatusBadge.tsx - Elegant status indicators
// components/FilePreview.tsx - Professional file preview modal
// components/UserProfile.tsx - Clean user profile component
```

### Navigation Structure
```
Header: Secure2Send Logo + User Menu
├── Client Dashboard
│   ├── Overview (progress summary)
│   └── Documents (upload interface)
├── Admin Dashboard (admin only)
│   ├── Clients (list all clients)
│   └── Documents (review queue)
└── Authentication
    ├── Login
    └── Register
```

## API Endpoints (IMPLEMENT ALL)

### Authentication APIs
```typescript
// app/api/auth/[...nextauth]/route.ts - NextAuth configuration
// app/api/register/route.ts - User registration endpoint
```

### Document Management APIs
```typescript
// app/api/documents/route.ts
// GET: List user's documents
// POST: Upload new document

// app/api/documents/[id]/route.ts
// GET: Download document (with authorization)
// PUT: Update document status
// DELETE: Remove document

// app/api/admin/documents/route.ts
// GET: List all documents for admin review
// PUT: Bulk update document statuses
```

### Client Management APIs
```typescript
// app/api/clients/route.ts
// GET: List all clients (admin only)

// app/api/clients/[id]/route.ts
// GET: Get client details and documents
// PUT: Update client status
```

## Environment Variables (.env.local)
```env
# Database
DATABASE_URL="file:./dev.db"

# NextAuth
NEXTAUTH_URL="https://your-repl-name--username.repl.co"
NEXTAUTH_SECRET="your-secure-secret-key-here"

# File Upload
UPLOAD_DIR="./uploads"
MAX_FILE_SIZE="52428800" # 50MB in bytes

# App Config
APP_NAME="Secure2Send"
APP_URL="https://secure2send.com"
```

## Required Dependencies (Install All)
```bash
# Core Next.js and React
npm install next@latest react react-dom typescript @types/node @types/react @types/react-dom

# Database and Auth
npm install @prisma/client prisma next-auth @next-auth/prisma-adapter bcrypt @types/bcrypt

# Forms and Validation  
npm install react-hook-form @hookform/resolvers zod

# UI Components and Styling
npm install @radix-ui/react-slot @radix-ui/react-dialog @radix-ui/react-dropdown-menu
npm install @radix-ui/react-progress @radix-ui/react-tabs @radix-ui/react-avatar
npm install class-variance-authority clsx tailwind-merge
npm install lucide-react

# File Upload and Interactions
npm install react-dropzone uploadthing @uploadthing/react
npm install framer-motion react-hot-toast

# Utilities
npm install date-fns recharts

# Development
npm install eslint eslint-config-next tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer
```

## shadcn/ui Setup (CRITICAL FOR PREMIUM LOOK)
```bash
# After creating the Next.js project:
npx shadcn-ui@latest init

# Install required shadcn/ui components:
npx shadcn-ui@latest add button input card badge progress dialog table tabs avatar dropdown-menu toast

# This will create components/ui/ folder with professional components
```
```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "next dev",
    "build": "next build",
    "start": "next start",
    "db:generate": "prisma generate",
    "db:push": "prisma db push",
    "db:seed": "tsx prisma/seed.ts",
    "db:reset": "prisma migrate reset --force"
  }
}
```

## Package.json Scripts
```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "next dev",
    "build": "next build",
    "start": "next start",
    "db:generate": "prisma generate",
    "db:push": "prisma db push",
    "db:seed": "tsx prisma/seed.ts",
    "db:reset": "prisma migrate reset --force"
  }
}
```

## Premium Features for Owner Demo

### 1. Stunning Landing/Login Page
- **Hero section** with professional copy about Secure2Send
- **Feature highlights** with icons and benefits
- **Elegant login form** with smooth animations
- **Trust indicators** and security badges

### 2. Beautiful Dashboard Experience
- **Metrics cards** showing completion percentage, pending documents, etc.
- **Visual progress** with animated progress bars and completion celebrations
- **Recent activity feed** with timeline-style updates
- **Quick actions** with prominent CTAs

### 3. Premium Document Upload Interface
- **Drag & drop zones** with hover animations and visual feedback
- **File preview thumbnails** for uploaded documents
- **Upload progress** with real-time percentage and smooth animations
- **Validation feedback** with elegant error states and success animations
- **Document requirements checklist** with checkmarks and progress

### 4. Professional Admin Interface
- **Clean data tables** with sorting, filtering, and search
- **Bulk actions** with checkboxes and batch operations
- **Document preview modal** with zoom and navigation
- **Quick approve/reject** buttons with confirmation dialogs
- **Activity timeline** showing all admin actions

### 5. Mobile-First Responsive Design
- **Touch-friendly** interfaces for mobile upload
- **Responsive tables** that work beautifully on small screens
- **Mobile navigation** with slide-out menu
- **Optimized forms** for mobile completion

## File Upload Implementation (Premium Version)
```typescript
// Use uploadthing for professional file handling
// Features to implement:
// - Drag & drop with visual feedback
// - Multiple file selection
// - Upload progress with cancel capability
// - File type validation with helpful messages
// - Preview thumbnails for images/PDFs
// - Automatic retry on failures
// - Success animations and celebrations
```

## Seed Data for Testing
Create seed script (prisma/seed.ts) with:
- **Admin User**: admin@secure2send.com / password123
- **Test Client**: client@test.com / password123  
- **Sample Documents**: Mock uploaded files for testing review process
- **All Document Types**: One example of each required document type

## Security Considerations (Prototype Level)
- **Password Hashing**: bcrypt with salt rounds
- **File Validation**: Check file types and sizes
- **Input Sanitization**: Validate all form inputs
- **Role-based Access**: Protect admin routes
- **Session Security**: Secure session management
- **File Access Control**: Only authorized users can download documents

## Success Criteria
✅ **Registration**: New clients can create accounts
✅ **Document Upload**: All 14 document types can be uploaded
✅ **Admin Review**: Admins can approve/reject documents
✅ **Progress Tracking**: Visual progress indicators work
✅ **Responsive Design**: Works on mobile and desktop
✅ **File Management**: Files are stored and retrievable
✅ **Status Updates**: Real-time status changes reflected in UI
✅ **Error Handling**: Graceful error messages and recovery

## Testing Checklist
1. **User Flow**: Register → Login → Upload Documents → View Status
2. **Admin Flow**: Login → Review Documents → Approve/Reject → Verify Updates
3. **File Handling**: Upload various file types and sizes
4. **Responsive**: Test on mobile, tablet, desktop
5. **Error Cases**: Invalid files, network errors, authorization failures

## CRITICAL IMPLEMENTATION NOTES

### DO NOT:
- Use any external UI libraries (no shadcn/ui, no Material-UI, etc.)
- Implement real email sending (just console.log for prototype)  
- Use external file storage services (local storage only)
- Add complex authentication providers (email/password only)
- Implement production-grade security features

### DO:
- Build all UI components from scratch using Tailwind
- Use TypeScript for everything
- Implement proper form validation with Zod
- Create reusable components
- Add loading states for all async operations
- Handle errors gracefully with user-friendly messages
- Make the interface intuitive and professional
- Use consistent naming (Secure2Send throughout)

### File Organization:
- Keep all components in app/components/
- Put reusable UI components in app/components/ui/
- Use clear, descriptive filenames
- Group related functionality together
- Follow Next.js App Router conventions exactly

## Final Notes
This is a working prototype that demonstrates the full application flow. Focus on creating a polished, professional interface that clearly shows how the document management system works. The admin should be able to easily review and manage documents, and clients should have a clear view of their progress through the compliance process.

Remember: This app is called "Secure2Send" and should reflect a professional, trustworthy brand throughout the interface./pdf", "image/jpeg", "image/png"]

client/src/components/dashboard/progress.content:
import { useQuery } from "@tanstack/react-query"; import { Card, CardContent } from "@/components/ui/card"; import { Progress } from "@/components/ui/progress"; import { BarChart3, CheckCircle, Clock } from "lucide-react"; import type { Document } from "@shared/schema"; export default function ProgressCards() { const { data: documents = [] } = useQuery({ queryKey: ["/api/documents"], }); const totalDocuments = 14; // Based on the required document types const uploadedCount = documents.length; const approvedCount = documents.filter((doc) => doc.status === 'APPROVED').length; const pendingCount = documents.filter((doc) => doc.status === 'PENDING').length; const rejectedCount = documents.filter((doc) => doc.status === 'REJECTED').length; const progressPercentage = Math.round((uploadedCount / totalDocuments) * 100); // Get remaining document types (simplified for demo) const remainingDocuments = [ "Cannabis License", "Operating Agreement", "Insurance Coverage" ].slice(0, Math.max(0, 3 - (uploadedCount - 11))); // Show some remaining docs return (

Upload Progress

Documents Uploaded {uploadedCount} of {totalDocuments}

{progressPercentage}% Complete

Approval Status

Approved {approvedCount}
Pending {pendingCount}
Rejected {rejectedCount}

Next Steps

Upload remaining:

    {remainingDocuments.length > 0 ? ( remainingDocuments.map((doc, index) => (
  • • {doc}
    • )) ) : (
  • • All documents uploaded!
    • )}
); }

client/src/components/ui/checkbox.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as CheckboxPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-checkbox"
import { Check } from "lucide-react"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Checkbox = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <CheckboxPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "peer h-4 w-4 shrink-0 rounded-sm border border-primary ring-offset-background focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:opacity-50 data-[state=checked]:bg-primary data-[state=checked]:text-primary-foreground",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator
      className={cn("flex items-center justify-center text-current")}
    >
      <Check className="h-4 w-4" />
    </CheckboxPrimitive.Indicator>
  </CheckboxPrimitive.Root>
))
Checkbox.displayName = CheckboxPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Checkbox }

)) NavigationMenuViewport.displayName = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Viewport.displayName const NavigationMenuIndicator = React.forwardRef< React.ElementRef, React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef >(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
)) NavigationMenuIndicator.displayName = NavigationMenuPrimitive.Indicator.displayName export { navigationMenuTriggerStyle, NavigationMenu, NavigationMenuList, NavigationMenuItem, NavigationMenuContent, NavigationMenuTrigger, NavigationMenuLink, NavigationMenuIndicator, NavigationMenuViewport, }

client/src/components/ui/progress.tsx.content:
"use client"

import * as React from "react"
import * as ProgressPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-progress"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Progress = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ProgressPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ProgressPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, value, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ProgressPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "relative h-4 w-full overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-secondary",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ProgressPrimitive.Indicator
      className="h-full w-full flex-1 bg-primary transition-all"
      style={{ transform: `translateX(-${100 - (value || 0)}%)` }}
    />
  </ProgressPrimitive.Root>
))
Progress.displayName = ProgressPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Progress }

client/src/components/ui/scroll-area.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as ScrollAreaPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-scroll-area"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const ScrollArea = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn("relative overflow-hidden", className)}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport className="h-full w-full rounded-[inherit]">
      {children}
    </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport>
    <ScrollBar />
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Corner />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
))
ScrollArea.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root.displayName

const ScrollBar = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
>(({ className, orientation = "vertical", ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar
    ref={ref}
    orientation={orientation}
    className={cn(
      "flex touch-none select-none transition-colors",
      orientation === "vertical" &&
        "h-full w-2.5 border-l border-l-transparent p-[1px]",
      orientation === "horizontal" &&
        "h-2.5 flex-col border-t border-t-transparent p-[1px]",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaThumb className="relative flex-1 rounded-full bg-border" />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
))
ScrollBar.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar.displayName

export { ScrollArea, ScrollBar }

client/src/components/ui/slider.tsx.content:
import * as React from "react"
import * as SliderPrimitive from "@radix-ui/react-slider"

import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

const Slider = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, ...props }, ref) => (
  <SliderPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn(
      "relative flex w-full touch-none select-none items-center",
      className
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <SliderPrimitive.Track className="relative h-2 w-full grow overflow-hidden rounded-full bg-secondary">
      <SliderPrimitive.Range className="absolute h-full bg-primary" />
    </SliderPrimitive.Track>
    <SliderPrimitive.Thumb className="block h-5 w-5 rounded-full border-2 border-primary bg-background ring-offset-background transition-colors focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2 disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50" />
  </SliderPrimitive.Root>
))
Slider.displayName = SliderPrimitive.Root.displayName

export { Slider }
